channel.title: Changeing A command

item.title: Changeing A command
item.dc:creator: @TheTutMan TheTutMan
item.description:
@TheTutMan wrote:

no i got the interface and i know how to open it it when you do some thing like ::tele(0,0,0) in the chat box it works but how would i make it so wen you click the button on the interface it comes up whith a box which you can type the infomation in

Read full topic

item.title: Changeing A command
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("commandName")) { openInterface("interfaceId"); }

Just code the interface now? I wouldn’t recommend you do it 100% based with a command because you’re not meant too. I don’t remember how PI works (amusing that’s what you’re using) so all you have to do is code the Interface (client sided) then add the action server sided.

Read full topic

item.title: Changeing A command
item.dc:creator: @TheTutMan TheTutMan
item.description:
@TheTutMan wrote:

so im makeing my own custom staff interface whith buttons. and when you click Teleport or update it opens a box where you can type the infomation in because you have to do ::teleport(Cords) or ::Update(time) How would i make it so it opens the box

this is my code for both commands

[code]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“update”) && c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“mod chris”)) {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
int a = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = a;
PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;
PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;
PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
}

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“Teleport”)) {
String[] arg = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (arg.length > 3)
c.getPA().movePlayer(Integer.parseInt(arg[1]),Integer.parseInt(arg[2]),Integer.parseInt(arg[3]));
else if (arg.length == 3)
c.getPA().movePlayer(Integer.parseInt(arg[1]),Integer.parseInt(arg[2]),c.heightLevel);
}[/code]

Thanks For your Help

Read full topic
